page.title: 16PARTRIDGE GREEN FIRE STATION
page.content: MR.MITCHELL,a well known village CHARACTER and owner of the long-established family butcher shop in the HIGH STREET,retired as CHIEF FIRE OFFICER in FEB.1985 after 37 years service.When the FIRE STATION SIREN sounded,voluntary firemen from the village including MR.MITCHELL stopped whatever they were doing immediately and rushed to help.Today an operator from the FIRE HEADQUARTERS in CHICHESTER sounds the alarm in Partridge Green and between 4 and 6 village FIREMEN go to help.The area includes:Cowfold,Ashurst,Dial Post,West Grinstead and Shipley.When interviewed MR.MITCHELL recalled an empty house which smelt of smoke for a week before it was realised that the house was on fire.
